presentation.title: CST8503 Presentation
presentation.subtitle: Knowledge Representation and Planning
presentation.subtitleSecondary: Solving planning problems with Knowledge Representation and Prolog

pages.title: CST8503 Presentation
pages.subtitle: Knowledge Representation and Planning
pages.subtitleSecondary: Solving planning problems with Knowledge Representation and Prolog

pages.title: Conclusion
pages.speaker: Jiaxing Yi
pages.mainPoint: Knowledge Representation provides a structured way to model the world using facts and logical rules, enabling systematic problem-solving through planning rather than random trial and error.

keyTakeaways.title: 1. Knowledge Representation
keyTakeaways.description: Provides a way to model the world using facts and logical rules

keyTakeaways.title: 2. Planning
keyTakeaways.description: Involves finding a sequence of actions from an initial state to a goal state

keyTakeaways.title: 3. Prolog's Recursive Structure
keyTakeaways.description: Makes it natural for implementing planners
